description_txt: stated on April 3, 2010 in a comment on Newsweek magazine's Web site :
quote_txt: "I never considered myself a maverick."

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2010 in an e-mail blast:
quote_txt: "An audit of the last census found that over 370,000 people living in Texas were not counted, and our state lost an estimated $1 billion in federal funds as a result."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2010 in an interview on Newsmax TV:
quote_txt: "If every house in Florida had a solar-heated water tank, that would eliminate consumption by 17 percent."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2010 in a column:
quote_txt: "The number of uninsured people in Massachusetts is about the same as it was when the mandates were passed in 2006."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2010 in Alexander Snitker in a campaign press release:
quote_txt: "Snitker has been virtually ignored by the major media."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: The Senate Republican education plan is an unfunded mandate for local school districts.

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2010 in an interview on C-SPAN's Washington Journal:
quote_txt: "More people are driving under the influence of drugs than are driving under the influence of alcohol. A recent roadside survey showed that 16 percent of the people tested, tested positive for illicit or licit drugs. That's significantly higher than alcohol."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2010 in a speech on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "With this reform, every insured American gets valuable consumer protections, and every uninsured American can become insured."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2010 in a statement on the group's Web site:
quote_txt: The Florida House is "holding the FINAL public hearing" of a controversial education bill in the middle of spring break..."when they hope (teachers) are not watching or listening."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: ''Both Democrats and Republicans are advocating for the use of student test scores to measure teacher effectiveness.''

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "As a state rep, I was considered the fourth-most conservative in the Legislature.”

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2010 in a prepared statement:
quote_txt: On recess appointments.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2010 in an interview on NBC's Today show:
quote_txt: "A lot of the ideas in terms of the (health insurance) exchange, just being able to pool and improve the purchasing power of individuals in the insurance market, that originated from the Heritage Foundation."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2010 in a song for Farouk Shami's gubernatorial campaign:
quote_txt: "Farouk is on fire."

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2010 in a statement on his campaign Web site.:
quote_txt: "Cuba wants to let the Chinese drill in some of the very parts of the gulf that American producers are currently forbidden to touch, as close as 45 miles off the Florida coast."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2010 in an announcement at Andrews Air Force Base :
quote_txt: On oil drilling

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2010 in a press release:

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: "On the day that (the Republican) state leader resigned in disgrace, a ‘Shred-It' truck rolled up to Republican headquarters."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a U.S. Senate primary debate on FOX News Sunday:
quote_txt: "Actually, Reagan was a Democrat before he was a Republican."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2010 in an appearance on the Fox News show "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: "The average student will be spending $1,700 to $1,800 more during the life of their loan because of this surcharge."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2010 in a Web site:
quote_txt: "An attack on a healthy 22-year-old homosexual man would be more protected under the law than an attack on an eight-year-old child."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a U.S. Senate primary debate on FOX News Sunday:
quote_txt: Charlie Crist "worked with Acorn" to give felons voting rights.

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in on CBS's "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: "The New England Journal of Medicine released a survey the week that President Obama signed Obamacare stating that over 30 percent of American physicians would leave the profession if the government took over health care."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a debate on Fox News Sunday:
quote_txt: Marco Rubio controlled funds that "out of the $600,000 that were raised, only $4,000 went to candidates to try to improve their chances to be elected to office."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2010 in a floor speech in the House:
quote_txt: "According to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office, the IRS would need to hire over 16,000 people ... to audit the American people and impose the new taxes and mandates" of the health care bill.

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a U.S. Senate primary debate on FOX News Sunday:

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a U.S. Senate primary debate on FOX News Sunday:
quote_txt: "Since that famous day in February where the governor campaigned with Barack Obama on behalf of the stimulus program, 211,000 Floridians have lost their jobs."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2010 in a U.S. Senate primary debate on FOX News Sunday:
quote_txt: "Just this week we received the news that for the first time Social Security is now paying out more in benefits than it's taking in. That was something that was supposed to happen in 2016."
